sel.math.vector

General utilies on vectors, math of vectors, conversion of vectors and collisions between boxes (3D vectors).

$(DDOC_MODULE_MEMBERS
struct Vector(T, char[] c) if (c.length > 1 && areValidCoordinates(c));
template Vector(T, string coords)
template Vector2(T)
template Vector3(T)
template Vector4(T)
$(DDOC_DECL_DD Vector for coordinates storing and operations.

const pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe Tuple tuple();
Gets the vector as a constant tuple.

Example:
auto v = vector(0, 3, 4);
assert(v.tuple == typeof(v).Tuple(0, 3, 4));


bool opEquals(F)(F value);
Compares the vector with another vector of the same length or with a single number.

Returns:
true if all the values are equals, false otherwise

Example:
assert(Vector2!int(0, 10) == Vector2!int(0, 10));
assert(Vector3!ubyte(1, 1, 255) == Vector3!real(1, 1, 255));
assert(vector(0, 0, 0, 0) == 0);
assert(vector(1, 2) == [1, 2]);
assert(vector(float.nan, float.nan) != vector(float.nan, float.nan));


typeof(this) opUnary(string op)() if (__traits(compiles, () { mixin("T t;t=" ~ op ~ "t;"); } ));
Performs an unary operation on the vector.

Returns:
the new vector

Example:
auto v = vector(-1, 0, 1);
assert(-v == vector(1, 0, -1));
assert(++v == vector(0, 1, 2)); // this will change the original vector's values!
assert(v-- == vector(0, 1, 2) && v == vector(-1, 0, 1));


typeof(this) opBinary(string op, F)(F value) if (op != "in");
Performs a binary operation on the vector.

Params:
F value a number, a vector or an array with the same size

Returns:
the new vector

Example:
assert(vector(1, 1) - 1 == vector(0, 0));
assert(vector(10, 10) * vector(0, 9) == vector(0, 90));
assert(vector(16, 15) & [15, 3] == vector(0, 3));
assert(1 - vector(100, 0, -100) == vector(-99, 1, 101));


typeof(this) opOpAssign(string op, F)(F value) if (isVector!F && coordinates == F.coordinates);
typeof(this) opOpAssign(string op, F)(F value) if (isArray!F);
typeof(this) opOpAssign(string op, F)(F value) if (isImplicitlyConvertible!(F, T));
Performs an assign operation on the vector, modifying it.

Params:
F value a number, a vector or an array with the same size

Returns:


Example:
auto v = vector(1, 2);
v += 4;
v *= [0, 2];
assert(v == vector(0, 12));


@safe auto opCast(F)() if (isVector!F);
Converts the vector to the given one, mantaining the variables's value when possible.

Example:
assert(cast(Vector2!int)vector(.1, .1, 14) == vector(0, 14));
assert(cast(Vector4!real)vector(.5, 100) == vector(.5, 0, 100, 0));
// this will only return the vector
assert(cast(Vector2!int
)
)


@safe auto opCast(F)() if (isArray!F);
Converts the vector into an array of the same size.

Example:
assert(cast(int[])vector(1, 2) == [1, 2]);
assert(cast(long[])vector(.1, 1.5, -.1) == [0L, 1L, 0L]);


auto type(F)() if (isImplicitlyConvertible!(F, T));
Changes the vector's type.

alias dup = type!T;
Duplicates the vector, mantaing the type, variables' names and their value.

Example:
assert(vector(1, 1).dup == vector(1, 1));


@property double length();
Gets the vector's length.

@property double length(double length);
Sets the vector's length.

string toString();
Converts the vector into a string for logging and debugging purposes.

auto vector(E...)(E args) if (E.length > 1 && E.length <= 4 && !is(CommonType!E == void));
Automatically creates a vector if the number of the given arguments matches one of the default vectors.

Example:
assert(is(typeof(vector(1, 1)) == Vector2!int));
assert(is(typeof(vector(2Lu, 4)) == Vector2!ulong));
assert(is(typeof(vector(5, 5, 19.0)) == Vector3!double));
assert(is(typeof(vector(0, real.nan, double.nan, float.nan)) == Vector4!real));


enum bool isVector(T);
Checks if the given type is a vector

nothrow @safe T round(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T);
Rounds a vector to the nearest integer.

Example:
assert(round(vector(.25, .5, .75)) == vector(0, 1, 1));


nothrow @safe T floor(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T);
Floors a vector to the nearest integer.

Example:
assert(floor(vector(.25, .5, .75)) == vector(0, 0, 0));


nothrow @safe T ceil(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T);
Ceils a vector to the nearest integer.

Example:
assert(ceil(vector(.25, .5, .75)) == vector(1, 1, 1));


nothrow @safe T abs(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T);
Calculate the absolute value of the array.

Example:
assert(abs(vector(-1, 0, 90)) == vector(1, 0, 90));


pure nothrow @nogc @safe bool isFinite(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T && T.isFloatingPoint);
Checks whether or not every member of the vector is finite (not infite, -inifite, nan).

Example:
assert(isFinite(vector(1, 2)));
assert(isFinite(vector(float.min, float.max)));
assert(!isFinite(vector(1, float.nan)));
assert(!isFinite(vector(-float.infinity, 1f/0f)));


pure nothrow @nogc @safe bool isNaN(T)(T vector) if (isVector!T && T.isFloatingPoint);
Checks whether or not at least one member of the vector is not a number (nan).

Example:
assert(!isNaN(vector(0, 2.1)));
assert(isNaN(vector(float.init, -double.init)));
assert(isNaN(vector(0, float.nan)));


@safe double distance(T, char[] coords, E)(Vector!(T, coords) vector1, Vector!(E, coords) vector2);
Calculates the distance between to vectors of the same length.

Params:
Vector!(T, coords) vector1 the first vector
Vector!(E, coords) vector2 the second vector

Returns:
the distance between the two vectors (always higher or equals than 0)

Example:
assert(distance(vector(0, 0), vector(1, 0)) == 1);
assert(distance(vector(0, 0, 0) == vector(1, 1, 1)) == 3 ^^ .5); // 3 ^^ .5 is the squared root of 3


V vector(V, T)(T tuple) if (isVector!V && isTuple!T);
Example:
alias DoublePosition = Vector3!float;


alias ChunkPosition = Vector!(int, "xz").Vector;
alias EntityPosition = Vector!(double, "xyz").Vector;
alias BlockPosition = Vector!(int, "xyz").Vector;
Vectors usually used by Minecraft

@property @safe ushort shortBlockPosition(BlockPosition position);
Gets a ushort that indicates a position in a chunk.

@property @safe BlockPosition blockPositionShort(ushort position);
Gets a BlockPosition from an ushort that indicates a position in a chunk.

@property @safe EntityPosition entityPosition(BlockPosition block);
Casts a BlockPosition to an EntityPosition using vector's opCast.

@property @safe BlockPosition blockPosition(EntityPosition entity);
Casts an EntityPosition to a BlockPosition using vector's opCast.
